Package neqsim.pvtsimulation.util

Class BlackOilTableValidator

java.lang.Object
neqsim.pvtsimulation.util.BlackOilTableValidator
public final class BlackOilTableValidator extends Object
Utility class for validating black-oil PVT tables per Whitson wiki guidelines.

Black-oil tables (Bo, Rs, Bg, μo, μg) must satisfy certain physical constraints for valid reservoir simulation. This class provides validation methods to ensure table consistency.

Reference: Whitson wiki (https://wiki.whitson.com/bopvt/black_oil/)

Key Validation Criteria:

  • Bo - Must decrease monotonically below bubble point
  • Rs - Must decrease monotonically below bubble point
  • Bg - Must increase monotonically with decreasing pressure
  • μo - Must increase with decreasing pressure (more gas liberated)
  • μg - Should increase with decreasing pressure

Usage Example:

 
 double[] pressures = {300, 250, 200, 150, 100};
 double[] Bo = {1.45, 1.40, 1.35, 1.30, 1.25};
 double[] Rs = {200, 170, 140, 110, 80};

 ValidationResult result = BlackOilTableValidator.validate(pressures, Bo, Rs, null, null, null);
 System.out.println(result.isValid());
 System.out.println(result.getReport());
Version:
1.0
Author:
ESOL

  • Method Details

    • validate

      public static BlackOilTableValidator.ValidationResult validate(double[] pressures, double[] Bo, double[] Rs, double[] Bg, double[] oilViscosity, double[] gasViscosity)
      Comprehensive validation of black-oil tables.
      Parameters:
      pressures - pressure values (bar), assumed decreasing
      Bo - oil formation volume factor (rm3/sm3)
      Rs - solution gas-oil ratio (sm3/sm3)
      Bg - gas formation volume factor (rm3/sm3), may be null
      oilViscosity - oil viscosity (cP), may be null
      gasViscosity - gas viscosity (cP), may be null
      Returns:
      validation result with status and detailed report

    • validateBoArray

      private static void validateBoArray(double[] pressures, double[] Bo, BlackOilTableValidator.ValidationResult result)
      Validate Bo array for monotonicity and physical bounds.

    • validateRsArray

      private static void validateRsArray(double[] pressures, double[] Rs, BlackOilTableValidator.ValidationResult result)
      Validate Rs array for monotonicity and physical bounds.

    • validateBgArray

      private static void validateBgArray(double[] pressures, double[] Bg, BlackOilTableValidator.ValidationResult result)
      Validate Bg array for monotonicity and physical bounds.

    • validateOilViscosityArray

      private static void validateOilViscosityArray(double[] pressures, double[] oilVisc, BlackOilTableValidator.ValidationResult result)
      Validate oil viscosity array.

    • validateGasViscosityArray

      private static void validateGasViscosityArray(double[] pressures, double[] gasVisc, BlackOilTableValidator.ValidationResult result)
      Validate gas viscosity array.

    • validateBoRsConsistency

      private static void validateBoRsConsistency(double[] pressures, double[] Bo, double[] Rs, BlackOilTableValidator.ValidationResult result)
      Validate consistency between Bo and Rs.

      At stock-tank conditions (Rs ≈ 0), Bo should approach a minimum value (dead oil FVF). The relationship between Bo and Rs should be smooth.

    • countMonotonicityViolations

      private static int countMonotonicityViolations(double[] pressures, double[] values, boolean shouldDecrease)
      Count monotonicity violations.
      Parameters:
      pressures - pressure array (assumed decreasing)
      values - property values
      shouldDecrease - true if property should decrease with decreasing pressure
      Returns:
      number of monotonicity violations

    • interpolate

      public static double interpolate(double[] pressures, double[] values, double targetPressure)
      Interpolate black-oil properties at a given pressure.

      Uses linear interpolation between table values. Extrapolation is not recommended.

      Parameters:
      pressures - pressure table (bar)
      values - property values
      targetPressure - pressure to interpolate at (bar)
      Returns:
      interpolated value, or NaN if out of range
